text:
National Doughnut Day is celebrated annually on the first Friday in June, and this year that falls on Friday, June 1. This sweet holiday was created in 1938 as a symbol of hope to honor The Salvation Army Donut Lassies who served the sweet treats to soldiers on the frontlines of World War I—and a lot has changed in the world of doughnuts since then.

According to Angie Goldberg, chief marketing officer at Dawn Foods, a global bakery manufacturer, Generation Z and millennial doughnut lovers look for exotic flavors in their doughnuts. In fact, 82 percent are interested in trying flavors like pickle, sriracha and s’mores.

Here are the top adventurous flavors according to a Dawn Foods survey:

S’mores (29 percent)

Mango (18 percent)

Alcohol-Inspired (17 percent)

Breakfast Cereal, Bacon-Infused and Peanut Butter & Jelly (three-way tie with 16 percent)

Even so, tried-and-true flavors remain beloved among the general population: More than 50 percent prefer classics like chocolate (22 percent), plain (16 percent) and old-fashioned (13 percent). For what it's worth, this Generation Y doughnut lover prefers glazed doughnuts over all other flavors.

If you're a doughnut lover seeking freebies, National Doughnut Day 2018 will be very tasty. I tracked down 11 chains offering a free doughnut or something else for free on National Doughnut Day 2018. Offers are listed here in alphabetical order by brand.

1. Cumberland Farms

On National Doughnut Day between 5 and 10 a.m., customers who purchase a dispensed beverage at any of Cumberland Farms' newly remodeled store locations throughout the Northeast and Florida will also receive a free doughnut. Doughnut flavors range from blueberry cake to cocoa and hazelnut-filled to chocolate-frosted.

2. Duck Donuts

One of the fastest-growing doughnut franchises is giving customers a free classic doughnut when they visit on June 1. Classics doughnuts include bare, cinnamon sugar or powdered sugar, no purchase necessary! The freebies don't stop there—each customer will also receive a buy one, get one (BOGO) free doughnut coupon (redeemable before June 17, 2018). This offer is at participating locations only.

3. Dunkin' Donuts

Get a free classic doughnut with any beverage purchase on June 1 at Dunkin' Donuts. This deal excludes specialty doughnuts, including cake batter doughnuts, apple fritter, coffee roll, éclair, Bismarck and Long Johns. It appears you do not have to be a member of the DD Perks program to receive this freebie.

4. Edible

Edible, formerly known as Edible Arrangements and best known for fruit baskets designed to look like flowers, has new fruit doughnuts launching just in time for Doughnut Day. These "doughnuts" are made with Granny Smith apples and 100 percent real chocolate with a variety of toppings. Normally priced at $4 for 1, $8 for 2, $19 for a half-dozen and $29 for a dozen, on National Doughnut Day 2018, you'll get a free Edible "doughnut." Then, from June 2 through 6, Edible has BOGO deals: buy one "doughnut," get one free, buy a dozen, get a dozen, etc.

5. Entenmann's

On National Doughnut Day, Entenmann's and The Salvation Army will be hosting more than 40 “Do Good Donut Parties,” by giving out free doughnuts to more than 8,500 veterans at various Salvation Army locations across the country. Visit The Salvation Army website to find a participating location.

6. Fractured Prune

Fractured Prune is celebrating National Doughnut Day by giving away a free OC Sand Doughnut, famous for its honey glaze and cinnamon sugar, to each customer. No purchase necessary at participating locations.

7. Krispy Kreme

You can get a free Krispy Kreme doughnut on June 1—no purchase necessary—all day long in honor of National Doughnut Day. Doughnut lovers will be able to select any doughnut they want from the entire menu at participating Krispy Kreme shops across the U.S.

8. LaMar's Donuts

LaMar's Donuts is giving away a free doughnut on June 1. LaMar's Donuts is a chain of gourmet doughnut bistros founded in Kansas City, Missouri, and headquartered in Denver, Colorado. LaMar's has more than 25 locations in five states.

9. Rise'n Roll Bakery

Rise'n Roll Bakery, a chain of Amish baked goods, is participating in National Doughnut Day with one free doughnut on June 1.

On National Doughnut Day 2018, every Walmart in America will celebrate by giving free doughnuts to customers. The doughnuts will be given away near the bakery department. The retailer expects to give away 1.2 million whole glazed doughnuts.

11. Yesway

Convenience store chain Yesway, with 88-plus locations (and growing) in Iowa, Texas, Oklahoma, Missouri and Kansas, is offering a free doughnut when you buy a coffee. This offer is all day at participating locations.
